definition[0]: to make a bad mistake or do something very stupid
example[0]: Youâ€™d better not screw up this time.
definition[1]: to spoil something by doing something stupid
example[1]: She realized that she had screwed up her life.
definition[2]: to move the muscles in your face in a way that makes your eyes seem narrow
example[2]: He screwed up his eyes against the bright light.
example[3]: Her face was screwed up with pain.
definition[3]: to make someone feel very unhappy, confused, or upset so that they have emotional problems for a long time
example[4]: It really screwed her up when her mother died.
definition[4]: to be brave enough to do something you are very nervous about
example[5]: I finally screwed up enough courage to talk to her.
